concept.title: Visits in Version 15 and Ad Hoc Analysis
concept.shortdesc: Describes updates to Visits when upgrading to Version 15.

conbody.p: Visits in Version 15 are processed the same as they are in version 14, with the following differences:

section.title: Visits Metric Includes Non-cookie Visitors
section.p: To calculate the Visits metric, version 14 reported only on visitors who accepted a tracking cookie. Version 15 more accurately measures Visits by including visitors who do not accept a tracking cookie. As a result, the Visits metric in most cases reports a larger value when compared to previous versions under the same circumstances.

This change affects any report that uses the Visits metric, including Path reports and calculated metrics. Calculated metric values can increase or decrease, depending on whether Visits is the denominator or numerator in the calculation. For example, in an Orders / Visit calculation the value is likely to decrease. In Visits / Visitor, the value is likely to increase.
To see the percentage of users who do not accept persistent cookies:
1. Click Site Metrics > Visitors > Unique Visitors.

The non-persistent cookie visitors are added to the results. You can download the report to CSV or Excel and divide the non-persistent cookie visitors by total visitors. This represents the percent by which the visits will increase after you upgrade to Version 15. This increase ranges from 0.2% (for report suites fed entirely by first party cookies) to 11-14% for report suites entirely on third party cookies.

section.title: Updated Visits Metric for Typed Bookmarked in Referring Domains Report
section.p: If you had the Visits metric enabled on the Referring Domains report in v14, you will notice a change to the Visit count on this report after upgrading to v15.
In v14, Typed/Bookmarked was counted anytime a visit contained a server call with no referrer specified, regardless of where the server call occurred during the visit.

Since the referrer can often be empty mid-visit due to actions such as Flash navigation and redirects, v15 was improved to count Typed/Bookmarked only when a visit starts with a server call with no referrer specified.
With this change, in v15 Instances of Typed/Bookmarked should match Visits, whereas, in v14, Instances were typically lower than Visits.
